intro: Saccoloma inaequale var. brasiliense, commonly known as the Brazilian false fern, is a rare and specialized plant belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests of South America. Its spores are dispersed through wind, and it reproduces primarily through vegetative propagation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
